lineup.title: Tyler Gaw - “Hey, Look at Us”
lineup.desc: CSS story time. A quick look back at CSS 13 years ago to see how far we’ve come and how much farther we’ll go.

lineup.title: Matthew Ström - “Everything you didn’t know you wanted to know about the color() function, or, don’t be RGBasic”
lineup.desc: I'll share the science and math behind colors, gamuts, and colorspaces, and how you can use all this knowledge with css's `color()` function to make the web more beautiful and accessible.

lineup.title: David East - “Bad at CSS”
lineup.desc: Are you bad at CSS? Yeah, I am too. My margins collapse, my grids blow out, and flexboxes are always a little too flexy. Whenever I check Twitter (X?) I see the greatest CSS tips from the greatest CSS developers and I feel like I don't know anything at all. I decided to change that. No, I didn't go and “learn” CSS by reading MDN or some other high quality resource. I started a podcast with a bonafide CSS expert, Adam Argyle, and invited several others as guests. And what did I learn? Even they feel like they're bad at CSS. So in this talk we're all going to come together as a sort of festivus, airing out our grievances of being bad at CSS. And just maybe we all might learn a little along the way.
